section.title: Installing Bind
section.para: We had to install the server and it's utilities to run the bind9 DNS server.
section.screen: apt install bind9

section.title: Changing default and global options
section.para: We changed the default configuration in /etc/default/bind9 to run the server in IPv4 -4 mode only.
section.screen: OPTIONS="-4 -u bind"
section.para: We updated the global options in /etc/bind/named.conf.options. The trusted section marks the IP addresses of our SDI servers as trusted. This is important since we only allow recursive requests from trusted IP addresses. See allow-recursion { trusted; }.
To apply the configuration changes we reloaded the server.
section.screen: service bind9 reload

section.title: Zones configuration
section.para: We set up the forward lookup zone in /etc/bind/zones/db.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. This maps host names to IPv4 addresses. It is to be mentioned here that you have to increase the serial number of the document each time you save changes. Otherwise the changes will not be loaded at the next server reload.
section.screen:
$TTL 604800 @ IN SOA ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. root.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. ( 2020050401 ; Serial 604800 ; Refresh 86400 ; Retry 2419200 ; Expire 604800 ) ; Negative Cache TTL ; ; name servers - NS records IN NS ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de.
; name servers - A records ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. IN A 141.62.75.108 sdi8a.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. IN A 141.62.75.108 www8-1.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. IN CNAME ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. www8-2.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. IN CNAME ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de.
section.para: For the reverse lookup zone we configured /etc/bind/zones/db.141.62.75.
section.screen:
$TTL 604800 @ IN SOA mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. root.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. ( 2020050401 ; Serial 604800 ; Refresh 86400 ; Retry 2419200 ; Expire 604800 ) ; Negative Cache TTL ; name servers IN NS ns8.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de.
; PTR Records 108 IN PTR sdi8a.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de.
section.para: We needed to add the new zones in /etc/bind/named.conf.local.

section.title: Error handling
section.para: To check the /etc/bind/named.conf.local we executed the named-checkconf command.
section.screen: named-checkconf /etc/bind/named.conf.local
section.para: And then we reloaded the bind9 service to apply the changes.
section.screen: service bind9 reload

section.title: Mail exchange (MX) record configuration
section.para: The last task was to configure the DNS server with a Mail Exchange entry for our domain. We did that by adding a MX record in /etc/bind/zones/db.mi.hdm-stuttgart.de. We used the not well configured mail server mx1.hdm-stuttgart.de.
section.screen: ; mail servers mx records @ IN MX 10 mx1.hdm-stuttgart.de.
section.para: After reloading the service we could check the configuration with a dig.
section.screen: dig @141.62.75.108 mi.hdm-stuttgart.de MX
